meanings.definition: To oversee or direct (a process or activity)
meanings.sent1: She was superintending the construction of the new bridge.
meanings.sent2: The manager is superintending the team meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was superintending the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be superintending the growth of the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: His role as a parent involves superintending his children's homework.

meanings.definition: The action of overseeing or directing something
meanings.sent1: Her superintending of the project ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: The superintending of the event was handled by the experienced staff.
meanings.sent3: The robot's superintending of the factory was quite efficient.
meanings.sent4: The queen's superintending of the kingdom was admired by all.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's superintending of the classroom created a positive learning environment.
